musicRepresentation

Class Chord

  • java.lang.Object
    • musicRepresentation.Chord
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SoundUnit

    public class Chord
extends java.lang.Object
implements SoundUnit
    The Chord class implements the SoundUnit class. A Chord is composed of a list of one or more Notes in the Chord. As per the new specifications, the duration of a Chord is determined by the first Note in the Chord. All other Notes in the Chord should have that same duration. A Chord also has a syllable, represented as a String, attached to it.
    Author:
    Eric

    • Constructor Detail

      • Chord

        public Chord(java.util.List<Note> listOfNotesInChord)
        The constructor method of the Chord class. The chordDurationMultiplier is set to be the duration of the first note's durationMultiplier. All other Notes in the Chord are set to have this first note's durationMultiplier as well.
        Parameters:
        listOfNotesInChord - Must be the order in which the Notes appear in the Chord. Cannot be empty.

        listOfNotesInChord

      • getDurationMultiplier

        public double getDurationMultiplier()
        Specified by:
        getDurationMultiplier in interface SoundUnit
        Returns:
        durationMultiplier representing the length of the Chord or Rest in comparison with the default length of the piece

      • setSyllable

        public void setSyllable(java.lang.String syllable)
        Parameters:
        syllable - the syllable to be sung on this Chord

      • multiplyDurationMultiplier

        public void multiplyDurationMultiplier(double factor)
        Mutator Method. This method is used to correctly set the duration length of the Notes in a Chord. This method is used when the duration of Notes are affected by being inside of a Tuplet. "In the case of a triplet, you should play each note or chord for 2/3 of the original duration. For a duplet, 3/2 of the original durations. And for a quadruplet, 3/4 of the original durations."
        Parameters:
        factor - the double to multiply each note.durationMultipler by. Should be either 2/3, 3/2, or 3/4.
